column4: We have recently had to expand out subnet and I had to change my Jaunty desktop from a 10.1.1.x, 255.255.255.0 address to a 10.1.2.x, 255.255.252.0 address.  My problem is that I can only see about 1/2 the computers on the that still have the 10.1.1.x, 255.255.255.0 configuration.  Does the subnet matter on the other computers?
yes
why can i see 1/2 the computers then?
We will not be able to change all of the subnets right away, is there any way around it?

it may be becase of your switch and it may be misbehaving drivers.  But EVERYTHING you want to communcate must be ont eh same subnet otherwise its looking for the bordcasts int he wrong place(technically what your are doing is called suprtnetting)
wow so it could be with the switch?
do you have a layer 2 switch?
yeah
then it may be "helping" you find the arp's of those boxes.  Really thoguh go fix your network
and that is why some are working and some not?
posibly
and others, thanks for the help
it also may just be the local arp cache of the systems
i could see that
no way around it then?
i would have to route the traffic
and have two different 255.255.255.0 networks right
sure, go set the netmask of all the boxes on it correctly and do not mix two networks on the same wire
we have a 20 year old Vax that no one knows how to change
I would go find someone who does know, that or put a router in front of it and keep its network seperate
again thanks for the help
for that matter if you have a vax I would assume you have real rotuers, setup two more more vlans and put the vax on one and the rest on the other then route the two togehter
that is a possibility
really though I would find someone who knows OPenVMS and can set it.  Changing its IP is not that hard.
